    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
West Ham United and Manchester clashed in a thrilling encounter that ended in a 2-2 draw. The match, held at West Ham's home stadium, was a testament to the excitement and unpredictability of football, with goals, fouls, substitutions, and a flurry of set-piece actions. Let’s dive into the extended detailed description of both halves of this pulsating match.

### First Half:

The match commenced with Manchester kicking off the proceedings at the sound of the referee’s whistle. Within the very first minute, West Ham's attacking prowess was on display as they managed to create an early chance. At 52 seconds, West Ham fired a shot on target, and just a second later, the ball found the back of the net, sending the home fans into a delirium of joy. This swift attack earned West Ham an early 1-0 lead and set the tone for what was to be an engaging contest.

Manchester, determined to bounce back, resumed play with their kick-off at 1 minute and 47 seconds. However, West Ham's aggressive approach saw them committing a foul at 2 minutes and 6 seconds, gifting Manchester an indirect free-kick at 2 minutes and 37 seconds. The game then experienced its first interruption as the ball went out of play at 4 minutes and 10 seconds. Manchester had an opportunity to equalize via a corner at 4 minutes and 36 seconds, but the ball soon went out of play again at 5 minutes and 35 seconds.

As the game progressed, possession switched frequently between the teams, with a series of throw-ins and ball-clearances disrupting the rhythm of the game. West Ham's defensive line exhibited moments of resilience, but their aggressive tactics led to another foul at 7 minutes and 20 seconds. Manchester struck back with a shot on target at 8 minutes and 45 seconds, immediately earning a penalty. The Manchester player took the shot with clinical precision, scoring the equalizer at 8 minutes and 46 seconds. The score was now level at 1-1.

West Ham restarted the game with a kick-off at 9 minutes and 24 seconds. The tempo of the game saw another upward shift until West Ham decided to make an early substitution at 12 minutes and 11 seconds, likely an adjustment to counter Manchester's growing confidence. A foul by Manchester at 13 minutes and 28 seconds handed West Ham another indirect free-kick opportunity at 13 minutes and 39 seconds, though it did little to change the scoreline.

The game continued with both sides trading fouls and trying to assert dominance. Notably, Manchester received a yellow card at 31 minutes and 26 seconds for a particularly rough challenge. This gave West Ham the chance to capitalize on a direct free-kick, but the opportunity went begging as the ball looped out of play at 33 minutes and 3 seconds.

As the clock ticked past the half-hour mark, West Ham kept the pressure on with a series of indirect and direct free kicks, clearance, and throw-ins. One such throw-in at 35 minutes and 40 seconds from Manchester was indicative of the see-saw battle waged on the field. Physical play did not wane, and at 38 minutes and 15 seconds, West Ham committed another foul, further earning themselves a yellow card.

The last few minutes of the first half were no different, with frequent interruptions due to fouls and goal attempts. Manchester had a chance to pull ahead with a direct free-kick at 39 minutes and 8 seconds but it soon resulted in a ball out of play at 39 minutes and 53 seconds. The first half concluded with both teams locked in a dynamic tussle, ending with Manchester's throw-in at 44 minutes and 17 seconds.

### Second Half:

The second half began with West Ham taking the kick-off. The early moments mimicked the first half with an immediate ball out of play at 14 seconds followed by a throw-in by Manchester at 22 seconds. The defensive efforts intensified on both sides with frequent clearances and throw-ins disrupting play.

Manoeuvring opportunities arose, with Manchester earning a direct free-kick at 2 minutes and 29 seconds, though it soon resulted in the ball going out of play at 2 minutes and 36 seconds. West Ham, seizing upon these breaks in play, took a throw-in at 2 minutes and 51 seconds and followed it up with a corner at 5 minutes and 14 seconds.

At 5 minutes and 36 seconds, West Ham’s attempts on target narrowly missed, causing the ball to go out of play. Manchester’s defensive unit efficiently cleared the ball at 5 minutes and 53 seconds, attempting to switch the momentum in their favor. Their efforts were met with resistance, culminating in another flurry of fouls and set pieces.

Midway through the second half, West Ham scored again in dramatic fashion. At 10 minutes and 23 seconds, they registered a shot on target which rippled the net, sending their supporters into raptures and pushing them ahead 2-1. This goal brought fresh energy into the match, prompting Manchester to quickly regain composure and continue with a kick-off at 11 minutes and 35 seconds.

The game was alive with activity. West Ham, buoyed by their goal, maintained offensive pressure, evidenced by a shot off target at 14 minutes and 43 seconds. Manchester, however, was resilient, consistently clearing the ball off their defensive third and looking for the equalizer.

Crucial substitutions were made, viewed as strategic chess moves by both managers. West Ham made substitutions at 19 minutes and 9 seconds aiming to bolster their ranks, while Manchester followed suit at 21 minutes and 50 seconds, injecting fresh legs into their setup. These moves appeared to be geared towards gaining the upper hand as the game entered a critical phase.

Manchester hit the crossbar with a considerable off-target attempt at 26 minutes and 17 seconds. West Ham’s defense demonstrated solid mettle, repeatedly clearing the ball and maintaining a tight formation. 

As the match approached the latter stages, Manchester was relentless in attack. Their perseverance paid off when at 35 minutes and 2 seconds, a shot on target materialized into a goal, leveling the scores at 2-2. The precision and finesse in Manchester's play drew applause, making it a much-deserved equalizer. West Ham resumed with a kick-off at 35 minutes and 48 seconds, desperately looking to regain their lead.

The resultant phases of play heightened in intensity with Manchester making a crucial substitution at 37 minutes and 42 seconds. Toward the closing stages of the match, West Ham earned multiple corners, one at 42 minutes and 37 seconds and another at 43 minutes and 10 seconds, keeping Manchester’s defense under relentless pressure. 

A series of fouls and yellow cards marked the final moments, indicative of the aggressive search for a winning goal by both teams. Manchester received another yellow card at 43 minutes and 57 seconds following a set-piece foul, while West Ham squandered a critical indirect free-kick in added time.

Through all the pressure, drama, and tactical battles, the scoreline stood unchanged, resulting in a 2-2 draw by the time the final whistle blew. The match showcased the tenacity, teamwork, and tactical astuteness of both teams, leaving fans from both sides with a memorable experience. It was a classic football game filled with the ebbs and flows that make the sport exhilarating.
